ðŸ“– Summary: SlateDB is an embedded storage engine built on a log-structured merge-tree (LSM-tree) architecture. It differentiates itself by writing data to object storage (like S3, GCS, etc.) instead of local disk, providing bottomless storage, high durability, and easy replication, trading off latency and API costs.
